tripiá¹­aka master Xuanzang respectfully received
Are there also future [afflictions]?
And so on, in detail.
Herein, there are two kinds of fetters.ğŸ”½One is deluded about specific characteristics.
The other is deluded about general characteristics.
Those deluded about specific characteristics are the fetters of craving, hatred, pride, jealousy, and stinginess.
Those deluded about general characteristics are the fetters of ignorance, wrong views, and doubt.
Among the fetters deluded about specific characteristics,
the fetter of craving can bind one to the five categories of objects in the three realms.
The future [fetters] that have not yet been severed definitely bind one to all objects in the three times.
As for the past [fetters], it is uncertain. If they arose before and have not yet been severed, then they bind one.
If they did not arise before, or if they arose but have already been severed, then they do not bind one.
The present [fetters] are also uncertain.
If they are present with regard to a certain object, then they bind one.
If they are not present, then they do not bind one.
The fetter of pride is also like this.
The fetter of anger binds to the five types of objects in the desire realm.
The future [anger] that has not yet been eliminated definitely binds to all objects of the three times.
The past [anger] is indefinite.
That is to say, if it has already arisen in the past and has not yet been eliminated, then it binds.
If it has not yet arisen in the past, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it does not bind.
The present [anger] is also indefinite.
That is to say, if it is present with regard to a certain object, then it binds.
If it is not present, then it does not bind.
The fetter of jealousy binds to the objects to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm.
The future [jealousy] that has not yet been eliminated definitely binds to all objects of the three times.
The past [jealousy] is indefinite.
That is to say, if it has already arisen in the past and has not yet been eliminated, then it binds.
If it has not yet arisen in the past, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it does not bind.
The present [jealousy] is also indefinite.
That is to say, if it is present with regard to a certain object, then it binds.
If it is not present, then it does not bind.
The fetter of stinginess is also like this.
The fetters that are deluded about the common characteristics
can bind to the five types of objects in the three realms.
Past and future [afflictions] that have not yet been eliminated definitely bind one to all events of the three times.
Present [afflictions] are indefinite.
That is to say, if they are present with regard to a certain event, then they bind one.
If they are not present, then they do not bind one.
This is called the brief explanation of the six small and seven large [afflictions].
If one is bound by the past attachment affliction with regard to a certain event,
is one also bound by the future [attachment affliction]?
The answer is: Yes.
Why is this?
It was previously stated that the attachment affliction can bind one to the five categories of events in the three realms.
The future [afflictions] that have not yet been eliminated definitely bind one to all events of the three times.
If one is bound by the future [attachment affliction], is one also bound by the past [attachment affliction]?
The answer is: If the past [attachment affliction] has already arisen and has not yet been eliminated, then one is bound.
If the past [attachment affliction] has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then one is not bound.
Why is this?

It was previously stated that the past attachment affliction is indefinite.ğŸ”½That is to say, if the past [attachment affliction] has already arisen and has not yet been eliminated, then one is bound.
If the past [attachment affliction] has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then one is not bound.
Question: If at a certain time past attachment has already been severed,
at that time future attachment has also already been severed.
If at a certain time past attachment has not yet been severed,
at that time future attachment has also not yet been severed.
Why is it now said that if it has not been severed in a previous life, one is bound,
but if it has not yet arisen or has arisen but been severed, one is not bound?
The masters of foreign countries say:
If it has not been severed in a previous life, one is bound,
this refers to the three grades of fetters in the middle.
If it has not yet arisen, one is not bound,
this refers to the three lower grades of fetters.
If it has arisen but been severed, one is not bound,
this refers to the three higher grades of fetters.
The masters of KaÅ›mÄ«ra say:
If it has not been severed in a previous life, one is bound,
this refers to the nine grades of fetters.
If it has not yet arisen, one is not bound,
this refers to the last three grades of fetters.
If it has arisen but been severed, one is not bound,
this refers to the first six grades of fetters.
It is like the past six types of attachment that have already been severed, and the future [attachment] is also like this.
Although the latter three types of attachment have not yet been severed, since they have not yet arisen,
they are bonds in the future, but not in the past.
The meaning here is explained as follows.
If there is future attachment that has not yet been severed with regard to a certain object,
there is also past attachment that has not yet been severed.
With regard to that object, there is also the meaning of being bound by past attachment.
If there is future attachment that has not yet been severed with regard to a certain object,
but past attachment has not yet arisen with regard to that object,
even if it arises elsewhere, it is still said to be unarisen with regard to that object.
If it arises and is severed, then with regard to that object there is no meaning of being bound by past attachment.
If there is bondage by past attachment with regard to a certain object, is there also bondage by present [attachment]?
The answer is: If it is present.
Why is this?
It is because it was previously said that present attachment is also indefinite.
That is to say, if it is present with regard to a certain object, then it binds.
If it is not present, then it does not bind.
This means that if the fetter of craving arises with regard to a certain object and is present,
then there is the meaning of being bound by the present fetter of craving.
If with regard to this object, the fetter of craving does not arise, or if another fetter arises and is present,
or if a wholesome or unwholesome and unobscured neutral mind is present,
or if the fetter of craving arises with regard to another object,
or if there is no mind, then there is no meaning of being bound by the present fetter of craving.
If there is a present [fetter], is there also a past [fetter]?
The answer is: If it has arisen before and has not yet been eliminated, then it binds.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it does not bind.
The meaning of this is explained in detail as above.
If there is a future fetter of craving with regard to a certain object, is there also a present [fetter]?
The answer is: If it is present.
The meaning of this is also explained as above.
If there is a present [fetter], is there also a future [fetter]?
The answer is: It is so.
The meaning of this is explained as above.
If there is past attachment to this thing, is there also future and present [attachment]? Answer: Future [attachment] is necessarily bound, but not necessarily present.
If there is past attachment to this thing, is there also future and present [attachment]? Answer: Future [attachment] is necessarily bound, and if it is present.
Here the meaning is as explained above.
If there is future and present [attachment], is there also past [attachment]?
Answer: If it arose previously and has not yet been eliminated, then it is bound.
If it did not arise previously, or if it arose previously but has already been eliminated, then it is not bound.
Here the meaning is also as explained above.
If there is future attachment to this thing, is there also past and present [attachment]?
Answer: There are four possibilities here.
There may be future [attachment] but not past or present.
This refers to the case where attachment has not yet been eliminated with regard to this thing.
And it has not yet arisen previously, or even if it has arisen previously, it has already been eliminated and is not presently manifest.
Here, attachment has not yet been eliminated shows that there is future attachment.
And it has not yet arisen previously, or even if it has arisen previously, it has already been eliminated excludes the presence of past attachment.
Is not presently manifest excludes the presence of present attachment.
There may be future and past without present.ğŸ”½This means that regarding this matter, the fetter of craving that arose before has not yet been eliminated and is not presently manifest.
Here, the phrase the fetter of craving that arose before has not yet been eliminated
shows that there is past craving.
The phrase is not presently manifest
refutes the presence of present craving.
Since there is the fetter of craving that arose before and has not yet been eliminated,
it also shows that there is future craving.
Therefore, it is not separately stated here.
There may be future and present without past.
This means that regarding this matter, the fetter of craving is presently manifest, but it has not arisen before, or having arisen, it has already been eliminated.
Here, the phrase the fetter of craving is presently manifest shows that there is present craving.
The phrase has not arisen before, or having arisen, it has already been eliminated
refutes the presence of past craving.
Since there is the fetter of craving that is presently manifest, it also shows that there is future craving, so the meaning of future existence is not separately stated.
There may be future and past and present.
It means that regarding this matter, the past attachment has not yet been eliminated and is also present.
Here, the past attachment has not yet been eliminated indicates the existence of past attachment.
Also present indicates the existence of present attachment.
Since there is past and present attachment, the future also exists, which is self-evident.
If there is past and present, does it also have the future?
The answer is yes.
The meaning here has already been explained above.
If there is present attachment binding to this matter, does it also have the past and future?
The answer is: The future is definitely bound. The past,
if it has arisen before and not yet been eliminated, is also bound.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but has been eliminated, it is not bound.
The meaning here is the same as explained above.
If there is past and future, does it also have the present?
The answer is: If it is present.
The meaning here is also the same as explained above.
As with the past, present, and future of attachment, the same is true for the other five hindrances.
It should be known that anger, pride, jealousy, and stinginess are not universal, and the same is true for the past, present, and future of the fetter of ignorance.
Although there is a difference in breadth, they can be classified together because the meaning of the fetters that are confused about their own characteristics is similar.
If there is a past fetter of view that binds to this thing, is there also a future [fetter of view]?
The answer is: Yes.
If there is a future [fetter of view], is there also a past [fetter of view]?
The answer is: Yes.
If there is a past fetter of view that binds to this thing, is there also a present [fetter of view]?
The answer is: If it is present.
If there is a present [fetter of view], is there also a past [fetter of view]?
The answer is: Yes.
If there is a future fetter of view that binds to this thing, is there also a present [fetter of view]?
The answer is: If it is present.
If there is a present [fetter of view], is there also a future [fetter of view]?
The answer is: Yes.
If there is a past fetter of view that binds to this thing, is there also a future and present [fetter of view]?
The answer is: The future [fetter of view] is definitely bound.
The present [fetter of view] is if it is present.
If there is future and present, are there also past [afflictions]?
Answer: It is like this. If there is a future view-fetter binding to this thing, are there also past and present [afflictions]?
Answer: Past [afflictions] are definitely binding.
Present [afflictions] are binding if they are present.
If there are past and present [afflictions], are there also future [afflictions]?
Answer: It is like this.
If there is a present view-fetter binding to this thing, are there also past and future [afflictions]?
Answer: It is like this.
If there are past and future [afflictions], are there also present [afflictions]?
Answer: If they are present.
Why is it so?
This is what was said earlier.
The fetters that are deluded about the common characteristics can bind to the five categories of things in the three realms.
Past and future [afflictions] that have not been severed definitely bind to all things of the three time periods.
Present [afflictions] are indefinite.
It means that if they are present, then they bind.
If they are not present, then they do not bind.
Like the view-fetter, it goes through the six [categories].ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
It should be known that the same is true for the fetters of grasping and doubt, and the pervasive ignorance, as they traverse the six [realms].
This is because the meaning of the fetters that are deluded about common characteristics is similar. Although there is a difference in breadth, they can be classified together.
If there is a past fetter of craving that binds to this thing, is there also a past fetter of hatred that binds?
The answer is: If it has already arisen and has not yet been eliminated, then it binds.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it does not bind.
This means that if there is a past fetter of craving that has already arisen and has not yet been eliminated,
there is also a past fetter of hatred that has already arisen and has not yet been eliminated.
There is also the meaning of a past fetter of hatred that binds to this thing.

Even if there is a past fetter of craving that has already arisen and has not yet been eliminated, but the past fetter of hatred has not yet arisen with regard to this thing, even if it has arisen in other places, it is still called unarisen with regard to this thing.
If it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then there is no meaning of a past fetter of hatred that binds to this thing.ğŸ”½Even if there is a past fetter of hatred that binds,
is there also a past fetter of craving that binds?
If the past [anger bond] has not yet been eliminated, it is bound. If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, it is not bound.
This means that if there is a past [anger bond] that has not yet been eliminated with regard to this object,
there is also a past [desire bond] that has not yet been eliminated.
There is also the meaning of being bound by the past [desire bond] with regard to this object.
If there is a past [anger bond] with regard to this object that has not yet been eliminated, but the [desire bond] has not yet arisen in the past,
even if it has arisen elsewhere, it is said to be unarisen with regard to this object.
If it has arisen but has already been eliminated, there is no meaning of being bound by the past [desire bond] with regard to this object.
If there is a past [desire bond] that binds,
does it also have a future [anger bond] that binds?
If it has not yet been eliminated, how has it not yet been eliminated?
This means that if one has not yet become free from the attachment to desire, there is also the meaning of being bound by the future [anger bond].
If there is a future [anger bond] that binds,
does it also have a past [desire bond] that binds?
If it has arisen in the past but has not yet been eliminated, it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen or has already been severed, it does not bind.
That is to say, if there is future enmity in this matter that has not yet been severed,
there is also past attachment that has not yet been severed.
There is also the meaning of past attachment binding in this matter.
If there is future enmity in this matter that has not yet been severed, but past attachment has not yet arisen,
even if it arises elsewhere, it is still called unarisen in this matter.
If it has arisen but has already been severed, there is no meaning of past attachment binding in this matter.
If there is past attachment binding in this matter,
is there also present enmity binding?
The answer is: if it is present.
That is to say, if there is past attachment that has not yet been severed in this matter,
and there is also enmity present, then there is the meaning of present enmity binding.
If in this matter one gives rise to other bonds that are present,
or gives rise to wholesome, unobscured, indeterminate minds that are present,
Or when the fetter of anger arises in another place,
or when there is no mind, then there is no meaning of being bound by the present fetter of anger.
If there is bondage by the present fetter of anger, is there also bondage by the past fetter of craving?
If it has already arisen and has not yet been eliminated, then there is bondage.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then there is no bondage.
That is to say, if the fetter of anger is present in this matter, and the fetter of craving that has already arisen has not yet been eliminated,
then there is also the meaning of being bound by the past fetter of craving in this matter.
Even if the fetter of anger is present in this matter, but the fetter of craving has not yet arisen in this matter,
even if it has arisen in another place, it is still called unarisen in this matter.
If it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then there is no meaning of being bound by the past fetter of craving in this matter.
If there is bondage by the past fetter of craving in this matter, is there also bondage by the past and present fetter of anger?
The answer is: There are four possibilities here.
There may be bondage by the past fetter of craving,
There is no past or present hatred fetter.
It means that regarding this matter, there is past attachment fetter that has not yet been eliminated.
There is no past hatred fetter.
Even if it has arisen, it has already been eliminated and is not presently manifest.
As for there is past attachment fetter that has not yet been eliminated here,
it shows that there is past attachment fetter.

There may be one who is bound by past attachment fetter and also bound by past hatred fetter, but not by present [hatred fetter].ğŸ”½It means that regarding this matter, there is past attachment fetter and past hatred fetter that have not yet been eliminated, but no present hatred fetter is manifest.

but not bound by past hatred fetter, and also not bound by present [hatred fetter].

The fetter of hatred is present, but the former [fetter of hatred] has not yet arisen, or even if it has arisen, it has already been eliminated.
As for the fetter of craving that arose previously has not yet been eliminated here,

As for the former [fetter of hatred] has not yet arisen, or even if it has arisen, it has already been eliminated,
it refutes the existence of a past fetter of hatred.
There may be one who is bound by the past fetter of craving,

and also bound by the past and present fetter of hatred.ğŸ”½It means that regarding this matter, the fetters of craving and hatred that arose previously have not yet been eliminated, and there is also the fetter of hatred that is present.
As for the fetters of craving and hatred that arose previously have not yet been eliminated here,
it shows that there are past fetters of craving and hatred.ğŸ”½As for the fetter of hatred is present,ğŸ”½it shows that there is a present fetter of hatred.
Even if there is one who is bound by the past and present fetter of hatred,
is he also bound by the past fetter of craving?
The answer is: If it arose previously and has not yet been eliminated, then he is bound.
If it has not yet arisen or has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it does not bind.
The meaning of this is explained in detail as before.
If there is past attachment to this thing,
is there also future and present aversion?
The answer is: There are three possibilities here.
There may be past attachment but neither future nor present aversion.
This refers to the case where attachment has arisen before in the form and formless realms and has not yet been eliminated.
Here, attachment has arisen before and has not yet been eliminated
shows that there is past attachment.
In the form and formless realms
excludes future and present aversion.
That there is no aversion should be understood as before.ğŸ”½There may be past attachment and future aversion but not present.
This refers to the case where attachment has arisen before and has not yet been eliminated, and aversion has not yet been eliminated but is not presently manifest.
Here, attachment has arisen before and has not yet been eliminated
shows that there is past attachment.
And if the fetter of anger has not yet been eliminated,
it shows that there is a future fetter of anger.
This is because one who has not yet eliminated it must have the meaning of being bound by the future.
As for not being present,
it denies the existence of the present fetter of anger.

There may be one who is bound by the past fetter of craving and also bound by the future and present fetter of anger.ğŸ”½This refers to one who has the fetter of craving arising before and not yet eliminated, and the fetter of anger present.
As for having the fetter of craving arising before and not yet eliminated here,
it shows that there is a past fetter of craving.
And as for having the fetter of anger present,
it shows that there is a present fetter of anger.
The existence of the future [fetter of anger] is not stated here, but it is understood by implication.
This is because if it is present, it must exist in the future.
If there is one who is bound by the future and present fetter of anger,

The answer is: If it arose before and has not yet been eliminated, then he is bound.

The meaning of this is explained in detail as before.
If there is past attachment to this thing,
is there also past and future aversion?
The answer is: There are three possibilities here.
There may be past attachment,
but no past or future aversion.
This refers to attachment to things in the form and formless realms that arose in the past and have not yet been eliminated.
Here, attachment that arose in the past and has not yet been eliminated shows the existence of past attachment.
To things in the form and formless realms
excludes the existence of past and future aversion.
There may be past attachment,ğŸ”½and there may be future aversion, but not past.
This refers to attachment to this thing that arose in the past and has not yet been eliminated,
and there is aversion that has not yet been eliminated,
but there is no aversion that arose in the past, even if it arose it has already been eliminated.
Here, attachment that arose in the past and has not yet been eliminated
shows the existence of past attachment.
There is aversion that has not yet been eliminated
shows the existence of future aversion.
If the fetter of anger arose before and has already been eliminated,
it blocks the existence of past anger.ğŸ”½There may be one who is bound by the past fetter of craving,
and also bound by the past and future fetter of anger.ğŸ”½This refers to one who has the fetters of craving and anger arising before and not yet eliminated regarding this matter.
Here, the phrase one who has the fetter of craving arising before and not yet eliminated
shows the existence of past craving.
The phrase one who has the fetter of anger arising before and not yet eliminated
shows the existence of past anger. The future [existence] is not stated because it is self-evident.
Because if there is past [anger], there must be future [anger].
If there is one who is bound by the past and future fetter of anger,
is he also bound by the past fetter of craving?
The answer is: If it arose before and has not yet been eliminated, then it binds.
If it did not arise before, or if it arose but has already been eliminated, then it does not bind.
The meaning of this is as explained in detail above.ğŸ”½If one is bound by the past fetter of craving regarding this matter,
is one also bound by the past, future, and present fetter of anger?
The answer to this has five sentences.
There may be past attachment bonds,
but no past, future, or present aversion bonds.
This refers to attachment bonds that arose in the past and have not yet been severed regarding dharmas of the form and formless realms.
Here, attachment bonds that arose in the past and have not yet been severed
shows there are past attachment bonds.
Regarding dharmas of the form and formless realms excludes aversion bonds of the three times.
There may be past attachment bonds and future aversion bonds,
but none past or present.
This refers to attachment bonds that arose in the past and have not yet been severed,
and aversion bonds that have not yet been severed.
But those that have not yet arisen, or having arisen have already been severed, are not present.
Here, attachment bonds that arose in the past and have not yet been severed
shows there are past attachment bonds.
Aversion bonds that have not yet been severed
shows there are future aversion bonds.
Those that have not yet arisen, or having arisen have already been severed
excludes past aversion bonds.
Not present means that past hatred is blocked.ğŸ”½There may be past attachment but not present hatred.
This means that there is past attachment but not present hatred.
That is to say, there is past attachment that has not yet been eliminated.
And there is present hatred that has not yet arisen.
Even if it has arisen, it has already been eliminated.
Here, past attachment that has not yet been eliminated
shows that there is past attachment. Present hatred that has not yet arisen
shows that there is present hatred.
The future is not mentioned but is understood by implication.
The meaning is as explained above.
Even if it has arisen, it has already been eliminated
blocks past hatred.ğŸ”½There may be past attachment but not present hatred.
This means that there is past attachment and hatred that have not yet been eliminated, but no present hatred.
Here, past attachment that has not yet been eliminated
It shows that there is past attachment.
One who has past hatred that has not yet been eliminated.
It shows that there is past hatred.
The future [hatred] is not mentioned here, but it is understood by implication.
The meaning is as explained above.ğŸ”½But one who has present hatred.
It excludes the existence of present hatred.
There may be one who is bound by past attachment.
There may also be one who is bound by past, future, and present hatred.
That is to say, regarding this matter, there is past attachment and hatred that has not yet been eliminated.
And there is present hatred.
Among them, one who has past attachment that has not yet been eliminated.
It shows that there is past attachment.
One who has past hatred that has not yet been eliminated.
It shows that there is past hatred.
One who has present hatred.
It shows that there is present hatred.
The future [hatred] is not mentioned here, but it is understood by implication.ğŸ”½Because one who has past and present [hatred] must also have future [hatred].
Suppose there is one who is bound by past, future, and present hatred.
Is there also past attachment that binds?
Answer: If it has arisen before and has not yet been eliminated, then it binds.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it does not bind.
The meaning here is explained in detail as before.
As with the fetter of anger, so it is with the fetters of jealousy and stinginess.
They are all only in the desire realm.
Attachment is opposed to them, forming seven small sentences.
As with the fetter of anger.
The difference is stated.
In the desire realm, in the dharmas that are eliminated by seeing,
and in the dharmas of the form and formless realms,
there is past attachment that has arisen before and has not yet been eliminated.
There is no past, future, or present jealousy or stinginess.
Here, past attachment that has arisen before and has not yet been eliminated shows two sets of seven sentences.
In the middle, there is past attachment in the desire realm, in the dharmas that are eliminated by seeing,
and in the dharmas of the form and formless realms, but there are no past, present, or future jealousy or stinginess.
This negates two sets of seven sentences.
In the middle, there is past, future, or present jealousy or stinginess.
This is different from the previously mentioned [afflictions] that are eliminated by seeing [the four truths] in the desire realm.
This is because the two fetters of jealousy and stinginess are only eliminated by cultivation.
If there is past attachment to this matter, is there also past pride?
The answer is: If it has already arisen and has not yet been eliminated, then it is attached to.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it is not attached to.
This means that if there is past attachment to this matter that has not yet been eliminated, there is also past pride that has not yet been eliminated.
There is also the meaning of past pride being attached to this matter.
Even if there is past attachment to this matter that has not yet been eliminated, but past pride has not yet arisen with regard to this matter,
even if it arises in other places, it is still called unarisen with regard to this matter.
If it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then there is no meaning of past pride being attached to this matter.ğŸ”½Even if there is past pride,
is there also past attachment?
The answer is: If it has already arisen and has not yet been eliminated, then it is attached to.
If it has not yet arisen or has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it does not bind.
This means that if there is a past birth of the fetter of pride in this matter that has not yet been eliminated,
there is also a past birth of the fetter of craving that has not yet been eliminated.
There is also the meaning of being bound by the past fetter of craving in this matter.
If in this matter there is a past birth of the fetter of pride that has not yet been eliminated, but the fetter of craving has not yet arisen,
although it arises elsewhere, it is also called not yet arisen in this matter.
If it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then there is no meaning of being bound by the past fetter of craving in this matter.
If there is a past fetter of craving that binds,
is there also a future fetter of pride that binds?
The answer is: so it is.
Why is this?
It was previously said that the fetter of pride can bind in the five categories of objects in the three realms.
The future [fetter] that has not yet been eliminated definitely binds those three times and all objects.
If there is a future fetter of pride that binds, is there also a past fetter of craving that binds?
The answer is: if it has arisen in the past and has not yet been eliminated, then it binds.
If it has not yet arisen or has already been severed, it does not bind.
That is to say, if there is a future bond of pride that has not yet been severed in this matter,
there is also a past bond of craving that has not yet been severed.
There is also the meaning of being bound by a past bond of craving in this matter.
If in this matter there is a future bond of pride that has not yet been severed, but the bond of craving has not yet arisen,
although it arises elsewhere, it is also called unarisen in this matter.
If it has arisen but has already been severed, then in this matter there is no meaning of being bound by a past bond of craving.
If there is a bond of past craving that binds in this matter,
is there also a bond of present pride that binds?
The answer is: if it is present.
That is to say, if there is a past bond of craving that has not yet been severed in this matter,
and there is also a bond of pride that is present, then there is the meaning of being bound by a present bond of pride.
If in this matter one gives rise to other bonds that are present,
or gives rise to a wholesome or unobscured-neutral mind that is present,
Or when the fetter of pride arises in another place,
or when there is no mind, then there is no present meaning of being bound by the fetter of pride.ğŸ”½Even if there is present bondage by the fetter of pride,
is there also past bondage by the fetter of craving?
The answer is: If it arose previously and has not yet been eliminated, then it binds.
If it did not arise previously, or even if it did arise, it is eliminated and does not bind.
That is to say, if the fetter of pride is present in this matter,
there is also the meaning of being bound by the past fetter of craving that arose previously and has not yet been eliminated in this matter.
Even if the fetter of pride is present in this matter, if the fetter of craving has not yet arisen in this matter,
even if it arises in another place, it is still called unarisen in this matter.
Even if it arises and is eliminated, there is no meaning of being bound by the past fetter of craving in this matter.
If there is bondage by the past fetter of craving in this matter,
is there also bondage by the past and present fetter of pride?
The answer is: There are four possibilities here.
There may be those bound by past attachment but not bound by past or present arrogance.
This refers to those who have attachment that arose in the past but has not yet been eliminated.
There is no arrogance that arose in the past, even if it did arise it has already been eliminated and is not presently manifest.
Here, those who have attachment that arose in the past but has not yet been eliminated
shows that there is past attachment that has not yet been eliminated.
There is no arrogance that arose in the past, even if it did arise it has already been eliminated
refutes the existence of past arrogance.
Is not presently manifest refutes the existence of present arrogance.
There may be those bound by past attachment
and bound by past arrogance but not by present [arrogance].
This refers to those who have attachment and arrogance that arose in the past but have not yet been eliminated.
There is no arrogance that is presently manifest.
Here, those who have attachment and arrogance that arose in the past but have not yet been eliminated
shows that there is past attachment and arrogance.ğŸ”½There is no arrogance that is presently manifest
refutes the existence of present arrogance.ğŸ”½There may be those bound by past attachment
and
And if there is present attachment, there is past pride.
That is to say, regarding this matter, there is attachment that arose in the past and has not yet been eliminated.
And there is present pride, but it has not yet arisen in the past, or even if it has arisen, it has already been eliminated.
Here, regarding the matter of attachment that arose in the past and has not yet been eliminated,
it shows that there is past attachment.ğŸ”½Regarding the matter of present pride,
it shows that there is present pride.
Regarding the matter of not yet arising in the past, or even if it has arisen, it has already been eliminated,
it blocks the existence of past pride.
There may be past attachment,
and there may be past and present pride. That is to say, regarding this matter, there is attachment and pride that arose in the past and have not yet been eliminated, and there is present pride.
Here, regarding the matter of attachment and pride that arose in the past and have not yet been eliminated,
it shows that there is past attachment and pride.
Regarding the matter of present pride, it shows that there is present pride.ğŸ”½Even if there is past and present pride,
is there also past attachment?
If the past [attachment] has not yet been eliminated, then [the past and present pride] are bound.
If the past [pride] has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then [the past and present pride] are not bound.
The meaning of this is explained in detail as before.ğŸ”½If there is a past attachment bond to this thing, is there also a future or present pride bond?
The answer is: The future [pride] is definitely bound, and the present [pride] is bound if it is present.
As for the future [pride] being definitely bound,
if the future pride has not yet been eliminated, it definitely binds all five categories in the three realms.
As for the present [pride] being bound if it is present, the meaning is as explained before.
If there is a future or present pride bond,
is there also a past attachment bond?
The answer is: If the past [attachment] has not yet been eliminated, then [the past attachment] is bound.
If the past [attachment] has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then [the past attachment] is not bound.
The meaning of this is explained in detail as before.ğŸ”½If there is a past attachment bond to this thing,ğŸ”½is there also a past and future pride bond?
The answer is: The future [pride] is definitely bound, and the past [pride] is bound if it has not yet been eliminated.
If the past [pride] has not yet been eliminated, then [one] is bound.
If the past [pride] has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then [one] is not bound.
The meaning of this is explained in the same way as before.
If there is past and future pride bondage,
is there also past attachment bondage?
Answer: If the past [attachment] has not yet been eliminated, then [one] is bound.
If the past [attachment] has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then [one] is not bound.
The meaning of this is also explained in the same way as before.
If there is past attachment bondage regarding this matter,
is there also past, future, and present pride bondage?
Answer: There are four possibilities regarding this.
There may be past attachment bondage and future pride bondage,
but neither past nor present [pride bondage].
This refers to the case where there is past attachment that has not yet been eliminated regarding this matter,
but there is no past pride, or even if it has arisen, it has already been eliminated and is not presently manifest.
Here, there is past attachment that has not yet been eliminated shows the existence of past attachment.
If the fetter of pride has not yet arisen or has already been eliminated,
it blocks the existence of past pride.
If it does not manifest in the present,
it blocks the existence of present pride.ğŸ”½The existence of future [pride] is not mentioned, but it is understood by implication.
Because if there is love, there must be pride.
There may be one who is bound by past love,

and also bound by past and future pride, but not by present [pride].ğŸ”½This refers to one who has love and pride that have arisen in the past but have not yet been eliminated, and who does not have pride manifesting in the present.
Here, the phrase has love and pride that have arisen in the past but have not yet been eliminated
shows the existence of past love and pride.
The phrase does not have pride manifesting in the present
blocks the existence of present pride.
The existence of future [pride] is not mentioned, but it is understood by implication.
The meaning is as explained above.
There may be one who is bound by past love,
and also bound by future and present pride, but not by past [pride].
This refers to one who has love that has arisen in the past but has not yet been eliminated,
And when the fetter of conceit is present, but the previously arisen [fetters] have been eliminated, even if they have arisen, [they have been eliminated].
Here, one who has the fetter of craving for existence that has arisen in the past and has not been eliminated,
shows that there is past craving.ğŸ”½One who has the fetter of conceit present,
shows that there is present conceit.
But who does not have the previously arisen [fetter], even if it has arisen, [it has been eliminated],
prevents the existence of past conceit.
The future [fetters] are not mentioned here, but are understood by implication.
Because when the fetter of conceit is present, there must be future [conceit].
There may be one who is bound by the past fetter of craving,
and also by the past, future, and present fetter of conceit.
That is to say, regarding this matter, there is the fetter of craving and the fetter of conceit that have arisen in the past and have not been eliminated,
and there is the fetter of conceit that is present.
Here, one who has the fetter of craving and the fetter of conceit that have arisen in the past and have not been eliminated,
shows that there is past craving and conceit.ğŸ”½One who has the fetter of conceit present,
shows that there is present conceit.
The future [fetters] are not mentioned here, but are understood by implication.
The meaning is as explained above.
If there is past, future, and present pride attachment,
is there also past attachment?
Answer: If it has already arisen and not yet been eliminated, then it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it is not bound.
The meaning here is explained in detail as before.
If there is past attachment bound to this thing,
is there also past ignorance attachment?
Answer: It is so.
Why is it so?
It was previously said that all attachments that are confused about common characteristics can bind to the five categories of things in the three realms.
Past [ignorance] that has not been eliminated definitely binds to all things of the three time periods.
Since ignorance is also an attachment to common characteristics, the answer is that it is so.
If there is past ignorance attachment, is there also past attachment?
Answer: If it has already arisen and not yet been eliminated, then it is bound.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it is not bound.
It means that if there is past ignorance that has not yet been eliminated with regard to this thing,
There may be past attachment that has not yet been severed.
There is also the meaning of being bound by past attachment to this matter.
If there is past ignorance that has not yet been severed regarding this matter,
but past attachment has not yet arisen,
even if it arises elsewhere, it is still called unarisen regarding this matter.
If it arises and is severed, there is no meaning of being bound by past attachment to this matter.
If there is bondage by past attachment to this matter, is there also bondage by future ignorance?
The answer is yes.
Why is it so?
It was previously said that the common characteristics of all bonds can bind in the five categories of affairs in the three realms.
Future [bonds] that have not yet been severed definitely bind all affairs in the three times.
If there is bondage by future ignorance,
is there also bondage by past attachment?ğŸ”½The answer is: If it arose in the past and has not yet been severed, then it binds.
If it did not arise in the past, or if it arose and was severed, then it does not bind.
That is to say, if there is future ignorance bondage that has not yet been severed in regard to this object,
there is also past craving bondage that has not yet been severed.
There is also the meaning of past craving bondage in regard to this object.
If there is future ignorance bondage that has not yet been severed in regard to this object, but craving bondage has not yet arisen in regard to this object,
even if it arises elsewhere, it is still said to be unarisen in regard to this object.
Even if it has arisen and been severed, there is no meaning of past craving bondage in regard to this object.
If there is past craving bondage in regard to this object,
is there also present ignorance bondage?
The answer is: if it is present.
That is to say, if there is past craving bondage that has not yet been severed in regard to this object,
and there is present ignorance bondage, then there is the meaning of present ignorance bondage.
If there is a present wholesome or unobscured-neutral mind in regard to this object,
or if there is present ignorance bondage elsewhere or when there is no mind, then there is no meaning of present ignorance bondage.
If there is present ignorance fetters,
are there also past love fetters?
Answer: If the previous birth has not yet been severed, then there are fetters.
If the previous birth has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been severed, then there are no fetters.
This means that if there is present ignorance fetters regarding this matter,
there is also past love fetters that have not yet been severed.
Regarding this matter, there is also the meaning of past love fetters.
If there is present ignorance fetters regarding this matter,
but past love fetters have not yet arisen,
even if they have arisen elsewhere, they are still considered unarisen regarding this matter.
If they have arisen but have already been severed, then regarding this matter,
there is no meaning of past love fetters. If there are past love fetters regarding this matter,
are there also past and present ignorance fetters?
Answer: Past [fetters] are definitely bound, and present [fetters] are if they are present.
The meaning of this is the same as explained above.
If there are past and present ignorance fetters,
Is there also past attachment that binds?
Answer: If it has arisen before and has not yet been eliminated, then it binds.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it does not bind.
The meaning of this is explained in detail as before.
If there is past attachment that binds to this thing,
is there also future and present ignorance that binds?
Answer: Future [ignorance] definitely binds, and present [ignorance] if it is present.
The meaning of this is explained in detail as before.
If there is future and present ignorance that binds,
is there also past attachment that binds?
Answer: If it has arisen before and has not yet been eliminated, then it binds.
If it has not arisen before, or if it has arisen but has already been eliminated, then it does not bind.
The meaning of this is explained in detail as before.
If there is past attachment that binds to this thing,
is there also past and future ignorance that binds?
Answer: It is so.
Why is it so?
It was previously explained that the common characteristics of all fetters can bind in the five categories of events in the three realms.
Because the past and future [fetters] that have not yet been severed definitely bind all events of the three times.
If there is bondage by the past and future fetter of ignorance,
is there also bondage by the past fetter of craving?
The answer is: If it arose in a previous life and has not yet been severed, then it binds.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been severed, then it does not bind.
The meaning of this is explained in detail as above.
If there is bondage by the past fetter of craving in this event,
is there also bondage by the past, future, and present fetter of ignorance?
The answer is: The past and future [fetters] must bind.
The present [fetter] binds if it is present.
The meaning of this is explained in detail as above.
If there is bondage by the past, future, and present fetter of ignorance,
is there also bondage by the past fetter of craving?
The answer is: If it arose in a previous life and has not yet been severed, then it binds.
If it has not yet arisen, or if it has arisen but has already been severed, then it does not bind.
The meaning of this is explained in detail as above.
